title: Nativ 2013 Campi Taurasini Eremo San Quirico Aglianico (Irpinia)
description: This opens with tobacco, ripe black plum and vanilla aromas. The dense palate offers prune, mocha and toasted oak flavors, with assertive tannins that leave an astringent finish. Drink through 2018.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2014 Falcata Crianza Red (Valencia)
description: Heavy oak, asphalt, chocolate and slightly weedy berry aromas open this blend of Garnacha Tintorera, Monastrell and Syrah. In the mouth, rubbery tannins create astringency. Fully oaked, spicy berry flavors include vanilla and clove notes, while an oak-dominated finish tastes creamy and herbal.

title: Palamà 2016 Arcangelo Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)
description: This refreshing, easy-drinking rosé has aromas of wild berries and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. Made from Negroamaro, the fruity palate offers ripe raspberry and strawberry, while a hint of nectarine gives it a tangy close.

title: Raphael 2014 First Label Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Notes of pressed apple and pear mingle into complexities of vanilla, clove and toast in this barrel-aged Chardonnay. Full bodied in style, it's a ripe richly textured wine but balanced briskly. The finish lingers long.

title: Robert Renzoni 2013 Big Fred's Red (Temecula Valley)
description: The nose of this blend is quite intriguing, full of aromatic herbs like spearmint, nettle and bay leaf set against a fruity berry backdrop. Jammy baked plum fruit meets that curious herbal spice on the palate, keeping it interesting through the finish.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This appellation blend's aromas are deep and dark, with blackberry, black plum, anise and thyme touches. Its flavors are aggressive, grabbing the taster's attention with black raspberry, elderberry and black pepper tones. The tannins are surprisingly grippy.

title: Gimenez Riili 2013 Padres Dedicados Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Wiry, slightly grassy aromas of raspberry and plum come with a touch of oaky vanilla. This Malbec feels downright hard and choppy due to tough gritty tannins. Plum and berry flavors come in blips rather than a harmonious whole, and this tastes of lactic oak and rubber on the finish.

title: El Solar de Orfila 2013 Oak Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Jammy raisiny berry aromas are soft and a bit flabby. In the mouth, this is dense, jammy and fleshy. Roasted plum and berry flavors carry a salted note, while this holds steady on the finish.

title: Enate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Somontano)
description: Gritty tomatoey aromas suggest rustic but underripe fruit. On the palate, this delivers a mix of freshness combined with a medium-full body. A mix of herbal berries and wood-based spice notes finish grabby and warm.

title: Hightower 2013 Merlot (Red Mountain)
description: The plum, herb and spice aromas are followed by ever so slightly dried-out-seeming cherry flavors. There's enjoyment to be had, but it seems slightly more evolved than its age indicates.

title: Kettmeir 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Delicate orchard fruit and hawthorn scents drift out of the glass in this wine. The light, vibrant palate offers green apple and white peach flavors framed by racy acidity, finishing crisp and refreshing.

title: Fess Parker 2014 Older Barrels Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling from neutral barrels is reserved on the nose, showing dust, light red fruit and earth aromas. The flavors are equally light, evoking red mulberry fruit and turned earth. Clean and quaffable, but not very exciting.

title: Feudo Solaria 2014 Foglio Cinquanta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: Made from 100% Nero d'Avola, this offers ripe red berry and Mediterranean herb aromas. It's straightforward, with red cherry, raspberry and baking spice flavors, framed by smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Figuière 2016 Magali Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a pale wine, light in fruit and texture. It is poised and crisp with some attractive red fruits. Lively and fruity, it makes a great apéritif style of rosé. Drink now.

title: Domaine du Cros 2015 Lo Sang del Païs  (Marcillac)
description: The name of the wine comes from the red rocks that make up the vineyard. It is fruity with ripe red-plum fruit and a generous tannic structure. With its youthful vigor, the wine is likely to develop further, although it is bright and fruity now.

title: Domaine du Tariquet 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a ripe style of Sauvignon Blanc with a warm soft character. The lightest hints of a herbal flavor are filled out with apple and white peach. Clean and with great fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Lakewood 2015 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Whiffs of candied orange peels and smoked nuts persist on this dry deftly balanced Riesling. The zesty lime and lemon flavors on the midpalate are tart and revitalizing, lingering through a long slightly earth-toned finish.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2015 Round Rock Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Easygoing shades of pressed apple and pear are invigorated by a backdrop of zesty lime and lemon acidity on the palate of this off-dry Riesling. It's refreshingly lime-scented with a lean lingering finish.

title: Le Albare 2016 Monte Majore  (Soave Classico)
description: Spanish broom and hawthorn aromas meld with whiffs of orchard fruit. On the zesty palate, a hint of grilled herb adds interest to pear and apple flavors while lively acidity lends freshness.

title: Lemelson 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Juicy fruit gum comes to mind here; the mix of flavors runs through rather candied stone and tropical fruits. Bright acids keep the mouthfeel a bit puckery. It's modest in weight, and shows a light lick of caramel as it finishes.

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Cep d'Or Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The wine is deliciously fruity, with its acidity and mineral edge held in check by the refreshing red-currant and lime flavors. It has a pale salmon-pink color and a tight edge that will allow it to age a few months. Mind you, it's delicious now.
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

title: Liberty Lake 2016 Tahija Dry Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of pear, citrus peel and fresh flower lead to a dry broad feeling palate. It shows warmth on the finish.

title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Totally pale in colored this wine has delicate hints of red fruits as well as a tight crisp mineral texture. There is a salty edge with touches of spice and pepper. The aftertaste is bright and fruity.

title: Domaine Souviou 2013 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This soft and fruity wine is attractive with its herbal flavors and red-currant fruits. It has gentle tannins and crisp acidity. Ready to drink, the wine finishes with a fruity aftertaste.

title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2016 Pierre et Paul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine has attractive red fruits and a warm ripe character. Dominated by Grenache, it has a light peppery edge as well as plenty of bright acidity to contrast the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Dominio de la Vega 2012 Paraje Tornel Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Plump soft aromas of berry fruits, raisin and prune hint at ripeness. This feels dense and chewy, with integrated tannins. Saucy savory berry and plum flavors suggest tomato sauce, while this tastes lightly oaky and minty on the finish.

title: Dürnberg 2016 Falkenstein Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: This wine's tight nose gives little away. Its light-bodied, dry and slightly spritzy palate delivers fresh lemon fruit, which lingers into the zesty finish. This easy, fresh and ready for immediate drinking.

title: MCV 2016 Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Bubblegum and strawberry scents pop on the nose of this bottling, along with clay-like and steely metallic notes. Rounded and plush red fruit shows on the palate, accented with muted earthy undertones. Not as tense or fresh as other pinks from the vintage.

title: Agricola Bellaria 2015 Oltre  (Greco di Tufo)
description: This offers Bartlett pear, citrus and of spring flower scents. The tangy palate shows yellow apple and lemon drop notes, with bright acidity that refreshes the ripe flavors.

title: AuburnJames 2009 Bella Vista Vineyard Block 1 and 4 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This mature block-designated wine shows round blackberry flavors offset by leather and smoke. Full bodied, it's densely built and powerfully ripe.
